intro: Gaultheria kitangladensis, commonly known as the Kitanglad wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of the island of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries, which are typically red or black, contain seeds and are an important food source for local wildlife. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
